definition: towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: How did this weather vane of the US economy become a car crash of a corporation?
sentences.chinese: 這個美國經濟的風向標是怎麼成爲一個公司的災難？

sentences.english: Move over Lady Gaga. There are some new blue-haired songstresses taking over this Halloween.
sentences.chinese: 藍頭髮的女歌手們正取代她成爲這個萬聖節的風向標。

sentences.english: In winter the weathervane often freezes up.
sentences.chinese: 氣象風向標在冬季經常僵立不動。

sentences.english: To face the career life is the vane of humanities education.
sentences.chinese: 面向職業生活是高職院校人文教育的風向標。

sentences.english: Robotics is recognized as the trendsetting approach toward the innovation development of the intelligent society.
sentences.chinese: 機器人技術是智能社會創新發展的風向標。

sentences.english: Shanghai property market is the real estate market weather vanes .
sentences.chinese: 上海樓市是全國房地產市場的風向標。

sentences.english: In the legislative post-assessment, the assessment index plays the role of mind vane.
sentences.chinese: 在立法後評估中，評估指標起到風向標的作用。

sentences.english: Huizhou farmland prices indicate Hui merchants capital flow.
sentences.chinese: 徽州田價是徽商資本流動的風向標。

sentences.english: In winter the weather vane often freezes up.
sentences.chinese: 氣象風向標在冬季經常僵立不動。

sentences.english: Adidas: The market leader and trendsetting company at the front football.
sentences.chinese: 市場的領袖以及足球領域的風向標。

sentences.english: He looked up at the weathercock.
But the breadth of the package, it seems to me, is at the very least a weathervane.
sentences.chinese: 不過這一新技術創新對我來說至少是一個風向標。

definition: lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
surveyor's pole/post (used for a landmark)/CL:根[gen1]/(fig.) goal/model/benchmark
in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
conferences and exhibitions, abbr. of 會議展覽|会议展览[hui4 yi4 zhan3 lan3]
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
domestic and international/at home and abroad
